results.title: Heysen on Heysen
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson Film and Television Productions, South Australian Film Corporation, Lesley Hammond and John Dick
results.brief_description: A filmic retrospective of a selection of paintings of Sir Hans Heysen, many from private collections, that reveal Heysen the man. Very lyrical, both visually and vocally.

results.title: Hey, Kelly!
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Penny Ritco, Wolf Koenig and Sook-Yin Lee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Playing Fair”.
During a friendly game of tag, Robert calls Kelly a racist name and a fight ensues. Both Kelly and Robert are given detention, and the Principal gives them a task where they must co-operate in order to achieve the desired end. It is through this co-operation and working together, that Robert realises that he has a great deal in common with Kelly, and that her “difference” is only “skin-deep”.

results.title: Hey Marcel
results.brief_description: Images of figures descending staircases are orchestrated in four movements. Made with the assistance of the Creative Development Branch of the Australian Film Commission. Music by Bill McDonald; idea suggested by Chris Kennedy; lighting by Graeme Wood and David Lindsay. No spoken word.

results.title: Hey babe
results.creator_credit: Rafal Productions, Canadian Film Development Corporation, Institut Quebecois, Arthur Voronka and Rafal Zielinski
results.brief_description: Starstruck 12-year-old Theresa (Yasmine Bleeth), a streetwise orphan, is determined to find fame and success in the show-business industry but it is not until she meets up with Buddy (Buddy Hackett), an aging vaudeville performer, that her dream finally becomes reality. Cast also includes Marushka Stankova, Vlasta Vrana, Denise Proulx.

results.title: Heute: Papageno
results.brief_description: One of Lotte Reiniger’s early silhouette films. Papageno, the happy bird catcher, is lonely all by himself with only the birds for company. He imagines the birds all turn into beautiful women. They disappear but a real woman, Papagena, comes along. When she is frightened away by a snake, Papageno tries to hang himself, but is saved by three parrots. Papagena returns and everything is happy again. Based on Mozart’s “Magic Flute” this film contains music and lyrics only.

results.title: Heureux Comme le Regard En France
results.brief_description:
Documentary on the Centre National d’Art et de Culture Georges Pompidou, better known as Beaubourg, in Paris. The Centre is presented through the events organised in 1977 by its various units, especially IRCAM (experimental music) and the Modern Art Museum.

Credits: Director, Frederic Rossif ; writer, Alain Jouffroy ; photography, Jacques Loiseleux, Jean Boffety ; music, Vangelis Papathanassiou.
Cast: Michel Duchaussoy [narration only].

results.title: Herzberg
results.brief_description: Gerhard Herzberg, winner of a Nobel Prize in 1971, is a molecular spectroscopist. This film shows Dr. Herzberg in his laboratory at the National Research Council in Ottawa where, with the aid of highly sophisticated instruments, he tracks down elusive bits of matter that are the keys to discovering what the planets, stars and the universe are made of.

results.brief_description: A promotional video which tells the history of Herring Island and the work of the Friends of Herring Island to develop this area as an urban nature reserve.

results.title: Herring gull behaviour
results.creator_credit: Education Development Center and James G. Schaadt
results.brief_description: This documentary charts the life of the herring gull, a seabird. Focusing on its life within its natural habitat, the film looks at such things as the behavioural characteristics of the herring gull. These include: feeding habits, mating rituals, breeding habits etc.
